00114 /*************************************************************************
00115 **
00116 ** At some point the CFE_PSP should support customizable timers, which at
00117 ** minimum can fall through to the OSAL timers. Until this is implemented
00118 ** in CFE_PSP, this redefinition supplies the same functionality to allow
00119 ** Scheduler to work out of box.
00120 **
00121 **************************************************************************/
00122 #ifndef CFE_PSP_MAX_TIMERS
00123 
00124 int32 CFE_PSP_TimerCreate(uint32 *timer_id, const char *timer_name,
00125                      uint32 *clock_accuracy, OS_TimerCallback_t  callback_ptr);
00126 int32 CFE_PSP_TimerSet(uint32 timer_id, uint32 start_time, uint32 interval_time);
00127 
00128 
00129 int32 CFE_PSP_TimerCreate(uint32 *timer_id,       const char         *timer_name,
00130                      uint32 *clock_accuracy, OS_TimerCallback_t  callback_ptr)
00131 {
00132    int32 Status = CFE_SUCCESS;
00133 
00134    Status = OS_TimerCreate(timer_id, timer_name, clock_accuracy, callback_ptr);
00135 
00136    if(Status == OS_SUCCESS)
00137    {
00138       Status = CFE_SUCCESS;
00139    }
00140 
00141    return Status;
00142 }
00143 int32 CFE_PSP_TimerSet(uint32 timer_id, uint32 start_time, uint32 interval_time)
00144 {
00145    return OS_TimerSet(timer_id, start_time, interval_time);
00146 }
00147 
00148 #endif

00151 /*******************************************************************
00152 **
00153 ** SCH_CustomEarlyInit
00154 **
00155 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00156 **
00157 ** This function MUST update SCH_AppData.ClockAccuracy to the
00158 ** resolution of the minor frame timer.
00159 ********************************************************************/
00160 
00161 int32 SCH_CustomEarlyInit(void)
00162 {
00163     int32             Status = CFE_SUCCESS;
00164     
00165     Status = CFE_PSP_TimerCreate(&SCH_AppData.TimerId,
00166                                  SCH_TIMER_NAME,
00167                                  &SCH_AppData.ClockAccuracy,
00168                                  SCH_MinorFrameCallback);
00169     
00170     return Status;
00171 
00172 } /* End of CustomEarlyInit() */
00173 
00174 
00175 /*******************************************************************
00176 **
00177 ** SCH_CustomLateInit
00178 **
00179 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00180 **
00181 ** This function MUST perform any startup synchronization required,
00182 ** and MUST finish setting up the major and minor frame timers. 
00183 ********************************************************************/
00184 
00185 int32 SCH_CustomLateInit(void)
00186 {
00187     int32  Status    = CFE_SUCCESS;
00188     
00189     CFE_ES_WaitForStartupSync(SCH_STARTUP_SYNC_TIMEOUT);
00190 
00191     /*
00192     ** Connect to cFE TIME's time reference marker (typically 1 Hz)
00193     ** to use it as the Major Frame synchronization source
00194     */
00195     Status = CFE_TIME_RegisterSynchCallback((CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t)&SCH_MajorFrameCallback);
00196     if (Status == CFE_SUCCESS)
00197     {
00198         /*
00199         ** Start the Minor Frame Timer with an extended delay to allow a Major Frame Sync
00200         ** to start processing.  If the Major Frame Sync fails to arrive, then we will
00201         ** start when this timer expires and synch ourselves to the MET clock.
00202         */
00203         Status = CFE_PSP_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_STARTUP_PERIOD, 0);
00204     }
00205 
00206     return Status;
00207 
00208 } /* End of SH_CustomLateInit() */
00209

00211 /*******************************************************************
00212 **
00213 ** SCH_CustomGetCurrentSlotNumber
00214 **
00215 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00216 ********************************************************************/
00217 
00218 uint32 SCH_CustomGetCurrentSlotNumber(void)
00219 {
00220     uint32  CurrentSlot;
00221     
00222     if (SCH_AppData.SyncToMET != SCH_NOT_SYNCHRONIZED)
00223     {
00224         CurrentSlot = SCH_GetMETSlotNumber();
00225         
00226         /* 
00227         ** If we are only concerned with synchronizing the minor frames to an MET,
00228         ** then we need to adjust the current slot by whatever MET time is prevalent
00229         ** when the Major Frame Signal is received.
00230         ** If we are synchronizing the Major Frame, then, by definition, LastSyncMETSlot
00231         ** would be a zero and the current slot would be appropriate.
00232         */
00233         if (CurrentSlot < SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot)
00234         {
00235             CurrentSlot = CurrentSlot + SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS - SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot;
00236         }
00237         else
00238         {
00239             CurrentSlot = CurrentSlot - SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot;
00240         }
00241     }
00242     else
00243     {
00244         CurrentSlot = SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone;
00245     }
00246     
00247     return CurrentSlot;
00248 } /* End of SH_CustomGetCurrentSlotNumber() */
00249 
00250 /*******************************************************************
00251 **
00252 ** SCH_CustomCleanup
00253 **
00254 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00255 ********************************************************************/
00256 
00257 void SCH_CustomCleanup(void)
00258 {
00259     /* unregister the TIME callback for the major frame */
00260     CFE_TIME_UnregisterSynchCallback((CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t)&SCH_MajorFrameCallback);
00261 
00262 } /* End of SH_CustomCleanup() */
00263 
00264 
00265 /*******************************************************************
00266 **
00267 ** SCH_GetMETSlotNumber
00268 **
00269 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see above
00270 ********************************************************************/
00271 
00272 uint32 SCH_GetMETSlotNumber(void)
00273 {
00274     uint32 SubSeconds = 0;
00275     uint32 MicroSeconds;
00276     uint32 Remainder;
00277     uint32 METSlot;
00278     
00279     /*
00280     ** Use MET rather than current time to avoid time changes
00281     */
00282     SubSeconds = CFE_TIME_GetMETsubsecs();
00283 
00284     /*
00285     ** Convert sub-seconds to micro-seconds
00286     */
00287     MicroSeconds = CFE_TIME_Sub2MicroSecs(SubSeconds);
00288 
00289     /*
00290     ** Calculate schedule table slot number
00291     */
00292     METSlot = (MicroSeconds / SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00293 
00294     /*
00295     ** Check to see if close enough to round up to next slot
00296     */
00297     Remainder = MicroSeconds - (METSlot * SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00298     
00299     /*
00300     ** Add one more microsecond and see if it is sufficient to add another slot
00301     */
00302     Remainder += 1;
00303     METSlot += (Remainder / SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00304     
00305     /*
00306     ** Check to see if the Current Slot number needs to roll over
00307     */
00308     if (METSlot == SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS)
00309     {
00310         METSlot = 0;
00311     }
00312     
00313     return METSlot;
00314     
00315 }
00316 
00317 
00318 /*******************************************************************
00319 **
00320 ** SCH_MajorFrameCallback
00321 **
00322 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see above
00323 ********************************************************************/
00324 
00325 void SCH_MajorFrameCallback(void)
00326 {
00327     /*
00328     ** Synchronize slot zero to the external tone signal
00329     */
00330     uint16 StateFlags;
00331 
00332     /*
00333     ** If cFE TIME is in FLYWHEEL mode, then ignore all synchronization signals
00334     */
00335     StateFlags = CFE_TIME_GetClockInfo();
00336     
00337     if ((StateFlags & CFE_TIME_FLAG_FLYING) == 0)
00338     {
00339         /*
00340         ** Determine whether the major frame is noisy or not
00341         **
00342         ** Conditions below are as follows:
00343         **    If we are NOT synchronized to the MET (i.e. - the Minor Frame timer
00344         **    has an acceptable resolution), then the Major Frame signal should
00345         **    only occur in the last slot of the schedule table.
00346         **
00347         **    If we ARE synchronized to the MET (i.e. - the Minor Frame timer is
00348         **    not as good as we would like), then the Major Frame signal should
00349         **    occur within a window of slots at the end of the table.
00350         */
00351         if (((SCH_AppData.SyncToMET == SCH_NOT_SYNCHRONIZED) && 
00352              (SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone != SCH_TIME_SYNC_SLOT)) ||
00353             ((SCH_AppData.SyncToMET == SCH_MINOR_SYNCHRONIZED) && 
00354              (SCH_AppData.NextSlotNumber != 0) && 
00355              (SCH_AppData.NextSlotNumber < 
00356               (SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS - SCH_AppData.WorstCaseSlotsPerMinorFrame - 1))))
00357         {
00358             /*
00359             ** Count the number of consecutive noisy major frames and the Total number
00360             ** of noisy major frames.  Also, indicate in telemetry that this particular
00361             ** Major Frame signal is considered noisy.
00362             */
00363             SCH_AppData.UnexpectedMajorFrame = TRUE;
00364             SCH_AppData.UnexpectedMajorFrameCount++;
00365 
00366             /*
00367             ** If the Major Frame is not being ignored yet, then increment the consecutive noisy
00368             ** Major Frame counter.
00369             */
00370             if (!SCH_AppData.IgnoreMajorFrame)
00371             {
00372                 SCH_AppData.ConsecutiveNoisyFrameCounter++;
00373                 
00374                 /*
00375                 ** If the major frame is too "noisy", then send event message and ignore future signals
00376                 */
00377                 if (SCH_AppData.ConsecutiveNoisyFrameCounter >= SCH_MAX_NOISY_MAJORF)
00378                 {
00379                     SCH_AppData.IgnoreMajorFrame = TRUE;
00380                 }
00381             }
00382         }
00383         else /* Major Frame occurred when expected */
00384         {
00385             SCH_AppData.UnexpectedMajorFrame = FALSE;
00386             SCH_AppData.ConsecutiveNoisyFrameCounter = 0;
00387         }
00388         
00389         /*
00390         ** Ignore this callback if SCH has detected a noisy Major Frame Synch signal
00391         */
00392         if (SCH_AppData.IgnoreMajorFrame == FALSE)
00393         {
00394             /*
00395             ** Stop Minor Frame Timer (which should be waiting for an unusually long
00396             ** time to allow the Major Frame source to resynchronize timing) and start
00397             ** it again with nominal Minor Frame timing
00398             */
00399             CFE_PSP_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00400     
00401             /*
00402             ** Increment Major Frame process counter
00403             */
00404             SCH_AppData.ValidMajorFrameCount++;
00405     
00406             /*
00407             ** Set current slot = zero to synchronize activities
00408             */
00409             SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone = 0;
00410             
00411             /*
00412             ** Major Frame Source is now from CFE TIME
00413             */
00414             SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource = SCH_MAJOR_FS_CFE_TIME;
00415             
00416             /* Clear any Major Frame In Sync with MET flags */
00417             /* But keep the Minor Frame In Sync with MET flag if it is set */
00418             SCH_AppData.SyncToMET &= SCH_MINOR_SYNCHRONIZED;
00419             
00420             /*
00421             ** Give "wakeup SCH" semaphore
00422             */
00423             OS_BinSemGive(SCH_AppData.TimeSemaphore);
00424         }
00425     }
00426 
00427     /*
00428     ** We should assume that the next Major Frame will be in the same MET slot as this 
00429     */
00430     SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot = SCH_GetMETSlotNumber();
00431 
00432     return;
00433 
00434 } /* End of SCH_MajorFrameCallback() */
00435 
00436 
00437 /*******************************************************************
00438 **
00439 ** SCH_MinorFrameCallback
00440 **
00441 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see above
00442 ********************************************************************/
00443 
00444 void SCH_MinorFrameCallback(uint32 TimerId)
00445 {
00446     uint32  CurrentSlot;
00447     
00448     /*
00449     ** If this is the very first timer interrupt, then the initial 
00450     ** Major Frame Synchronization timed out.  This can occur when
00451     ** either the signal is not arriving or the clock has gone into
00452     ** FLYWHEEL mode.  We should synchronize to the MET time instead.
00453     */
00454     if (SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource == SCH_MAJOR_FS_NONE)
00455     {
00456         SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource = SCH_MAJOR_FS_MINOR_FRAME_TIMER;
00457         
00458         /* Synchronize timing to MET */
00459         SCH_AppData.SyncToMET |= SCH_PENDING_MAJOR_SYNCH;
00460         SCH_AppData.SyncAttemptsLeft = SCH_MAX_SYNC_ATTEMPTS;
00461         SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot = 0;
00462     }
00463     
00464     /* If attempting to synchronize the Major Frame with MET, then wait for zero subsecs before starting */
00465     if (((SCH_AppData.SyncToMET & SCH_PENDING_MAJOR_SYNCH) != 0) &&
00466         (SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource == SCH_MAJOR_FS_MINOR_FRAME_TIMER))
00467     {
00468         /* Whether we have found the Major Frame Start or not, wait another slot */
00469         CFE_PSP_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00470 
00471         /* Determine if this was the last attempt */
00472         SCH_AppData.SyncAttemptsLeft--;
00473 
00474         CurrentSlot = SCH_GetMETSlotNumber();
00475         if ((CurrentSlot != 0) && (SCH_AppData.SyncAttemptsLeft > 0))
00476         {
00477             return;
00478         }
00479         else  /* Synchronization achieved (or at least, aborted) */
00480         {
00481             /* Clear the pending synchronization flag and set the "Major In Sync" flag */
00482             SCH_AppData.SyncToMET &= ~SCH_PENDING_MAJOR_SYNCH;
00483             SCH_AppData.SyncToMET |= SCH_MAJOR_SYNCHRONIZED;
00484             
00485             /* CurrentSlot should be equal to zero.  If not, this is the best estimate we can use */
00486             SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone = CurrentSlot;
00487             SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot = 0;
00488         }
00489     }
00490     else
00491     {
00492         /*
00493         ** If we are already synchronized with MET or don't care to be, increment current slot
00494         */
00495         SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone++;
00496     }
00497 
00498     if (SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone >= SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS)
00499     {
00500         /*
00501         ** If we just rolled over from the last slot to slot zero,
00502         ** It means that the Major Frame Callback did not cancel the
00503         ** "long slot" timer that was started in the last slot
00504         **
00505         ** It also means that we may now need a "short slot"
00506         ** timer to make up for the previous long one
00507         */
00508         CFE_PSP_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_SHORT_SLOT_PERIOD, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00509         
00510         SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone = 0;
00511         
00512         SCH_AppData.MissedMajorFrameCount++;
00513     }
00514 
00515     /*
00516     ** Determine the timer delay value for the next slot
00517     */
00518     if (SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone == SCH_TIME_SYNC_SLOT)
00519     {
00520         /*
00521         ** Start "long slot" timer (should be stopped by Major Frame Callback)
00522         */
00523         CFE_PSP_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_SYNC_SLOT_PERIOD, 0);
00524     }
00525     
00526     /*
00527     ** Note that if this is neither the first "short" minor frame nor the
00528     ** last "long" minor frame, the timer is not modified.  This should
00529     ** provide more stable timing than introducing the dither associated
00530     ** with software response times to timer interrupts.
00531     */
00532 
00533     /*
00534     ** Give "wakeup SCH" semaphore
00535     */
00536     OS_BinSemGive(SCH_AppData.TimeSemaphore);
00537 
00538     return;
00539 
00540 } /* End of SCH_MinorFrameCallback() */
00541
